content:
Our team noticed that the current build of the QI-Core IG removes the reference to US-Core and replaces it with a reference to DAF - specifically, in the "Relationship to Other Initiatives" section at http://www.hl7.org/fhir/current/qicore.

Is this intentional? Other documentation seems to state that DAF was superseded by US-Core, but we wanted to confirm that there isn't some intentional change to how FHIR 3.0.1, US-Core, and QI-Core are related in the latest version. Thanks,
I don't think it's intentional. @Chris Moesel ?

@Kenny Blanchette, that is an old version of the "current" build, the URL of the current build changed when we updated the publishing approach, the current build is now here. We are in the final stages of publishing the new STU3 version of QI-Core (publication request was approved by CQI on Friday). In the new version, the relationship to US-Core is clarified here.
Specifically, QI-Core derives from US-Core profiles wherever possible.
